name: James Hoffmann's Ultimate V60
description: A meticulously crafted pour-over method by coffee expert James Hoffmann.

steps.instruction: Add {coffeeAmount}g of coffee to v60 filter.
Add {coffeeAmount*2}g of water to wet the coffee evenly.
Gently swirl the coffee slurry to ensure even saturation and let it rest and bloom for 45 seconds.
Pour water up to {waterAmount*0.6}g of total water.
Complete pouring water up to {waterAmount}g.
Stir with a spoon to remove any remaining coffee grounds of the wall. Give it a gentle swirl.
Allow coffee to drawdown and enjoy!

name: Tetsu Kasuya's 4:6 Method
description: A technique developed by Tetsu Kasuya, winner of the 2016 World Brewers Cup.

steps.instruction: Add {coffeeAmount}g of coffee to the filter.
Pour {waterAmount/5}g of water and wait 45 seconds for the coffee to bloom.
Pour {waterAmount/5}g of water and wait 45 seconds.
Pour {waterAmount/5}g of water and wait 45 seconds.
Pour {waterAmount/5}g of water and wait 45 seconds.
Final pour of {waterAmount/5}g of water and wait 45 seconds for the coffee to drawdown.
Allow to drawdown and enjoy!

name: Scott Rao classic V60 recipe
description: Scott Rao's V60 recipe focuses on even extraction and a consistent brew.

steps.instruction: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60, Pour in grounds, flatten.
Pre-wet with {3 * coffeeAmount}g of water.
Gently excavate to wet all the grounds within 10 seconds.
Let the coffee bloom.
Start main pour until {waterAmount}g.
Gently stir to stop grounds from clinging to sides
Swirl V60 to flatten coffee bed for even brew
Drawdown should be complete within 3 minutes.
Rinse filter & pre-heat V60, Pour in grounds, flatten
Bloom with {0.25 * waterAmount}g of water.
Pour {0.375 * waterAmount}g of water.
Pour {0.375 * waterAmount}g again and swirl gently. Wait until completely drained.
Add {0.25 * waterAmount}g of ice and stir until cooled to 5-10Â°C
Serve over fresh ice cubes

name: James Hoffmann Iced V60 recipe
description: James Hoffmann's take on iced filter coffee.

steps.instruction: Rinse filter above the sink to avoid heating the server. Pour in coffee grounds. Place {0.4 * waterAmount}g of ice in the server. Place on the scale and zero it out.
Pre-wet with {3 * coffeeAmount}g of water.
Stir a little and let the coffee bloom.
Slowly pour till {0.6 * waterAmount}g. of water.
Stir once clockwise and anticlockwise.
Swirl the server to melt the ice. Pour over fresh ice cubes in the glass.

name: James Hoffmann V60 - One cup recipe
description: James Hoffmann's recipe for one-cup V60.

steps.instruction: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60. Pour in grounds.
Pre-wet with {0.2 * waterAmount}g of water.
Gently swirl the V60 and let the coffee bloom.
Pour up to {0.4 * waterAmount}g. total.
Wait for 10 seconds.
Pour up to {0.6 * waterAmount}g. total.
Wait for 10 seconds.
Pour up to {0.8 * waterAmount}g. total.
Wait for 10 seconds.
Pour up to {waterAmount}g. total.
Gently swirl and wait for the complete drawdown.
